purpleculture_pinyin:
dān
to undertake; to carry; to shoulder; to take responsibility
чтобы провести; нести; плечом; взять на себя ответственность

dàn
picul (100 catties, 50 kg); two buckets full; carrying pole and its load; classifier for loads carried on a shoulder pole
пикуль (100 кошек, 50 кг); два ведра полны; несущий столб и его груз; классификатор для нагрузок, переносимых на плечевой штанге
rtega_mnemonic:
擔擔RS
担担		carry, bear, undertake
  • talk too much (chatter) 詹 while carrying something in hand 扌 to the market
  • ⓢ hand 扌 putting something on the shoulder in the morning 旦 to carry to the market
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 担)
Pictophonetic: 詹 indicates the sound; 扌 (hand) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
擔心 [ dān xīn ]: anxious; worried; uneasy; to worry; to be anxious
擔任 [ dān rèn ]: to hold a governmental office or post; to assume office of; to take charge of; to serve as
擔保 [ dān bǎo ]: to guarantee; to vouch for
擔子 [ dàn zi ]: carrying pole and the loads on it; burden; task; responsibility; Classifiers: 副
擔擔麵 [ dàn dàn miàn ]: Sichuan noodles with a spicy and numbing sauce
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 扌 [ shǒu ] hand
    • 詹 [ zhān ] talkative, verbose; surname
heisig_chinese_memo: The snitch assumed he would get out of jail when making a snitch deal and shaking the detective's hand (fingers). Of course the detective screwed him over.
Ru_trainchinese:
dān: (глаг) нести (на коромысле)
dàn: (сущ/сч.слово) ноша, бремя; дань (мера веса, равная 50 кг); вещь, переносимая на плечах
dān: (глаг) предпринимать, брать на себя
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The snitch assumed he would get out of jail when making a snitch deal and shaking the detective's hand (fingers). Of course the detective screwed him over.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " hand " and " zhan ", the original meaning is shoulder pick. "Mandarin ‧ Qiyu": "Bear, ren, bear, lotus, serve cows and horses, and take Thursdays."

" Tank " can mean carrying, carrying. Jin Ganbao's "Sou Shen Ji" Volume Sixteen: "The ghost will first take the responsibility for the number of miles."

" Tang " can also mean undertaking . Volume One of "Two Moments Pai An Surprise": "Those who have capital are not willing to bear this kind of relationship and do such nothing important."

" Pan " also means a pole and things hanging at both ends. "Yuefu Poetry Collection‧ Xianghe Song Ci San‧ Mo Shangsang": "The traveler sees Luo Fu, and he squeezes his mustache."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " hand " and " zhan ", the original meaning is shoulder pick.
humanum_full_description:
從「手」，「詹」聲，本義為肩挑。《國語‧齊語》：「負、任、擔、荷，服牛、軺馬，以周四方。」

　　「擔」可表示背負、負載。晉干寶《搜神記》卷十六：「鬼便先擔定伯數里。」

　　「擔」也可表示承當。《二刻拍案驚奇》卷一：「有本錢的人，不肯擔這樣干繫，幹這樣沒要緊的事。」

　　「擔」還表示扁擔和掛在兩頭的東西。《樂府詩集‧相和歌辭三‧陌上桑》：「行者見羅敷，下擔捋髭鬚。」

①挑東西的用具，多用竹、木做成：扁擔。
②一挑東西：擔子。勇挑重擔。
③中國市制重量單位，一擔等於一百斤。
④量詞，用於成擔的東西：一擔水。

從「 手 」，「 詹 」聲，本義為肩挑。《國語‧齊語》：「負、任、擔、荷，服牛、軺馬，以周四方。」 「 擔 」可表示背負、負載。晉干寶《搜神記》卷十六：「鬼便先擔定伯數里。」 「 擔 」也可表示承當。《二刻拍案驚奇》卷一：「有本錢的人，不肯擔這樣干繫，幹這樣沒要緊的事。」 「 擔 」還表示扁擔和掛在兩頭的東西。《樂府詩集‧相和歌辭三‧陌上桑》：「行者見羅敷，下擔捋髭鬚。」
From the sound of " hand" and " zhan", the original meaning is shoulder pick. "Mandarin ‧ Qiyu": "Bear, ren, bear, lotus, serve cows and horses, and take Thursdays." " Tank" can mean carrying, carrying. Jin Ganbao's "Sou Shen Ji" Volume Sixteen: "The ghost will first take the responsibility for the number of miles." " Tang" can also mean undertaking. Volume One of "Two Moments Pai An Surprise": "Those who have capital are not willing to bear this kind of relationship and do such nothing important." " Pan" also means a pole and things hanging at both ends. "Yuefu Poetry Collection‧ Xianghe Song Ci San‧ Mo Shangsang": "The traveler sees Luo Fu, and he squeezes his mustache."

擔字的基本解释

擔
dān

擔
dàn
均见“担”。

擔字的汉语字典释义

[①]［dān］
［《廣韻》都甘切，平談，端。］
“担4”的繁体字。
(1)肩挑。
(2)背负；负载。
(3)承当。
(4)举，戴。
(5)方言。拿。
(6)用同“耽”。参见“擔誤”、“擔擱”。
(7)用同“呆”。
[②]［dàn］
［《廣韻》都濫切，去闞，端。］
“担5”的繁体字。
(1)扁担和挂在两头的东西。
(2)扁担。
(3)容器名。引申为一石或一百斤之量。
(4)用以计成挑的东西。
(5)轿子。
[③]［shàn］
［《集韻》時豔切，去豔，禪。］
假借。

擔字的康熙字典解释

【卯集中】【手字部】　擔； 康熙笔画：17； 页码：页459第01
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】都甘切【正韻】都藍切，?膽平聲。與儋同。背曰負，肩曰擔。【釋名】擔，任也，任力所勝也。【易·繫辭負且乗疏】負者，擔負於物也。【戰國策】蘇秦嬴縢履蹻，負書擔囊。　又左擔，地名。【任豫益州記】隂平縣北有左擔道，於成都爲西，自北來者，擔在左肩，不得度右肩也。　又武擔，山名。在成都西北。【蜀志·先主傳註】蜀王妻物故，發卒擔土於成都郭中葬，高七丈，號曰武擔也。　又去聲。【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?都濫切。謂所負也。【左傳·莊二十二年】弛于負擔。【註】丁暫反。　又【集韻】時豔切，音贍。假也。【禮·喪服四制】杖者，何也，爵也。或曰擔主。【儀禮·喪服】無爵而杖者何，擔主也。【註】假之以杖，尊其爲主也。　又以贍切，音豔。義同。

擔字的源字形

字源演变：

楷体

擔字的起名意思

暂无。

Burden
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［dān］
["Guang Yun" are all willing to cut, flat talk, end. ]
Traditional Chinese characters for "輪4".
(1) Shoulder.
(2) Carrying; load.
(3) Undertaking.
(4) Lift, wear.
(5) Dialects. take.
(6) Use the same as "delay". See also "fear", "fear".
(7) Use the same "stay".
[②]［dàn］
["Guangyun" all cut indiscriminately, go to Kan, end. ]
The traditional characters of "輪5".
(1) Poles and things hanging at both ends.
(2) The pole.
(3) Container name. The extension is the amount of one stone or one hundred catties.
(4) Something used to count as a pick.
(5) Sedan chair.
[③]［shàn］
["Ji Yun" is Yan cut, go Yan, Zen. ]
Under the guise.
Burden
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Mao Collection] [Hand Character Department] 　dan; Kangxi Strokes: 17; Page Number: Page 459 01
[Tang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] All Gan cut [Zheng Yun] All blue cut,? Dan flat sound. Same as Dan. Carrying means carrying, shoulder means carrying. 【Release Name】Thanks, Ren Ye, and Ren force wins. 【Yi·XiCi Negative and Multiplying Shu】The one who bears the burden is also responsible for things. [Warring States Policy] Su Qin Ying was walking along, carrying books.　Zuodan again, place name. [Records of Renyu Yizhou] There is Zuodan Road in the north of Yinping County, and west of Chengdu. Those who come from the north bear on the left shoulder, not the right shoulder.　You Wudan, the name of the mountain. In the northwest of Chengdu. [Shu Zhi·Annotation to the First Master's Biography] The king of Shu's wives was buried in Guozhong, Chengdu, and the name was Wu Dan.　Go again. [Tang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] [Zheng Yun]? All cut. That is also the burden. [Zuo Zhuan·22 Years of Zhuang] Relaxed with burdens. [Note] Ding temporarily reversed.　[Jiyun] Shiyan cut, sound. Fake too. [Four systems of rituals and mourning dresses] Those with sticks, He Ye, Jue Ye. Or it is the Lord. [Rituals and mourning clothes] Whoever has a rod without a nobleman is also a master. [Note] The fake one uses the rod, and respects it as the main one.　 Cut again with 衡, the sound is colorful. The same meaning.
